title: Google announces $40 billion Texas investment to expand AI
description: HOUSTON, Texas — Google announced on Friday a major $40-billion investment in Texas through 2027 to build new cloud computing and artificial intelligence (AI) infrastructure, marking the latest in a series of massive technology investments in the US state.

title: EU bows to pressure on AI, privacy rules
description: BRUSSELS — The European Union is set next week to kickstart a rollback of landmark rules on artificial intelligence and data protection that face powerful pushback on both sides of the Atlantic.
content:
BRUSSELS — The European Union is set next week to kickstart a rollback of landmark rules on artificial intelligence and data protection that face powerful pushback on both sides of the Atlantic.

title: Pothole ahead: AI, the new eyes on US roads
description: Cities and states in the US are turning to artificial intelligence to improve road safety and combat fatalities.
content:
As America's aging roads fall further behind on much-needed repairs, cities and states are turning to artificial intelligence to spot the worst hazards and decide which fixes should come first.

title: Artificial intelligence continues to test the limits of creativity, commerce, and control

title: Artificial intelligence continues to test the limits of creativity, commerce, and control
description: From an artist's stealth AI installation in a national museum to a synthetic country song topping the Billboard charts, this week's round-up looks at how generative and multimodal AI are shaping industries as diverse as beauty, advertising, and language preservation

title: Video platform Vine is being rebooted as DiVine
description: The app, now called DiVine, is launching with a twist aimed at keeping artificial intelligence out of the feed.
content:
(CNN) - The short-form video platform Vine, once famous for its six-second loops, has been rebooted.
The app, now called DiVine, is launching with a twist aimed at keeping artificial intelligence out of the feed.
Backed by former Twitter CEO Jack Dor... [462 chars]
